title: @Riot - unbanning a pro cheater Nicolaj “Incarnation” Jensen
body:
http://kotaku.com/for-the-first-time-a-banned-league-of-legends-pro-gets-1695047985

So, just to be clear here, you threw out a lifetime ban to this player. A LIFETIME BAN:

“As a result of this player’s history of DDOS activity, abusive behavior and poor sportsmanship, the player behavior team has issued a lifetime ban on Jensen... “His Veigodx account has been permabanned and **all future accounts will be permabanned on sight**.”

Then, somehow, this player has proven to have been reformed, by playing a game he was banned from?

"...has continued to demonstrate behavior in game that is well above the normal standards of good behavior across all of his accounts since at least January 2014... “Additionally, according to our monitoring tools, he has not been implicated in any DDOS or Drophacking-related exploits since Q2 2013... There have been no serious offenses or violations of the letter or spirit of the Summoner Code since his account-sharing related offense in Q1 2014.”

How can he possibly have demonstrated reformedbehavior IN A GAME HE WAS BANNED FROM?

I'm sure you have a great explanation here, so let's hear it.

replies.body: Maybe he was unbanned because he has no life?

> The reason Jensen was even able to be afforded the sort of second life he just was by Riot is because of a change the company made to its permabanning and suspension policies late last year. As they explained in an announcement last November, the company had begun “introducing a new framework for long-term bans and permabans that treats all bans as suspensions subject to periodic review.”

Why would Riot need to provide you answers when the answers you seek are in the article you mention? Read the entire article before you start foaming at the mouth.

Also, 

> Like everything else in League, the game’s policies for addressing toxic behavior are always changing.

Put on your big boy pants and stop freaking out.

Put on your common sense pants. How can someone be "reformed" by playing a game they were banned from? That's not reform at all, that's completely ignoring the punishment. That's like going out after your parents have grounded you, big boy.

It's just another example of how Riot does EXACTLY the OPPOSITE of what they say they're doing.

And another example of how fan bois like you will stick up for a company that shows a blatant disrespect and disregard for any player who's not pro.

> The reason Jensen was even able to be afforded the sort of second life he just was by Riot is because of a change the company made to its permabanning and suspension policies late last year. As they explained in an announcement last November, the company had begun “introducing a new framework for long-term bans and permabans that treats all bans as suspensions subject to periodic review.”

Riots policies are constantly changing. **Its right there in the article.** I have seen multiple NON-PROs get emails from Riot telling them they can create a new account. And play the game, but they will be monitored to ensure the Toxic, ToS offending behavior is no longer an issue.

Riot has an entire department dedicated to player to player interaction, attitudes, and toxic players. They do not just focus on Pro-Players. Just like anything the only ones that make waves, get publicity, and are well known of are the PRO PLAYERS. Media outlets that cover information, multiple interviewers, and most of reddit give next to no shit, about Johnny2Shoes Silver 2, but that doesn't mean that they do not receive notifications about being able to return to play LoL if they would like.

So please, just stop acting like I'm defending Riot. I'm not FanBoying for them.  I just think your rage, immaturity, and complete ignorant comments need to be corrected.

Like he said, it's in the article.

> Ostensibly, the change in Riot’s punitive standards was meant to fit in with their overall philosophy of improving in-game behavior by providing toxic players with tangible opportunities to rehabilitate themselves and reform their behavior, rather than just be kicked out of the game never to be seen again. Jensen was therefore **allowed to keep playing League**—albeit not at the same competitive level he might be sans permaban—and Riot could monitor his behavior to see if he’d actually improved at all with time and experience.

(Bolding mine) I'm not saying I agree or not, but later on he was allowed to keep playing while being monitored....
God, you sir are amazing. I didn't think of actually quoting that. >.<

Are you seriously under the understanding that all of this happened over night?

He was Perma-Banned. And the next minute he was unbanned?

Is that what you think happened? DO you even know when he was banned? Do you know how long this whole process has been? If you don't, then please shut up. 

You are raging about something you don't understand. You sound like a Darude Sandstorm thumping Donger raising rage monster. 

Here I will give you some knowledge on the situation:

At 01/23/2013 Incarnati0n got permabaned in every Riot-affilied Tournament due to behavior issue. [Here's the EUW Forum Post](http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1015978)

At 04-02-2013 Riot official updated (including the Account Sharing) [Official Banning by Riot](http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1122163)

11/20/2014 Riot announce that they are going to look into their policy about Perma-bans. Most noticeable mentioning Pros that this applies to (Note this is 19 months AFTER HIS PERMA-BAN) [Read it and learn something](http://eune.lolesports.com/articles/competitive-policy-revision-permabanned-players)

03/31/2015 Riots announcement on Incarnati0n (More than 3 months after Riots announced the changes to Perma-Ban Policies) [Results of the 11/20 Policy change](http://na.lolesports.com/articles/2015-mid-year-long-term-suspension-reviews)

Once again, chill out kid.

Try to follow me here, because it seriously seems like you don't understand english.

Player is BANNED from game, to include ALL other accounts owned by and made by the person.
Player CONTINUES TO PLAY, WITH RIOTS KNOWLEDGE.
IS MAGICALLY REFORMED, by disregarding the punishment.

Can you follow the logic? PLAYER CANNOT PLAY IF BANNED. PLAYER PLAYS ANYWAYS, AND IS REWARDED BY REMOVING THE BAN. Not a difficult concept to understand. You can't be reformed if you don't follow the punishment. You break out of jail, you think you're a normal citizen now?

Are you seriously this dense?

You can list all the changes to policy you want. This dude ignores his punishment and gets rewarded for it.

Try to follow this.

Player is Banned. Player stays banned for over a year.
Company that banned player changes their policy and notifies the player that they can play again, but will be monitored by the COMPANY.
Player creates new account (or hell the company unbans the account) plays for 4 months and the Company sees noticeable improvements in player behavior and announces they are open to Competitive Environment.

Your logic is flawed, you seem to think that he was playing for the 19+ months he was banned and Riot just let him. They didn't. They changed their policy, notified him that he could play. He played while they monitored him and they see a reform in his behavior. HENCE the second announcement that he is eligible for competitive play.

I return the question you posed to me: *Are you seriously this dense?*

I believe the "will be banned on site" caveat was intended to mean "will be banned perminently the moment we detect similar behavior." Not to mention its hard to perm ban someone who has paid real money for things to go on the account that are exclusive to the account.  The things he purchased technically become his property and by banning him its like someone taking your stuff and locking it in a safe. Its yours but it does you 0 good to own it if you can't get in the safe to use it.
Actually, in the ToS, it states that everything about your account, including your username, game time, and even skins and RP, belong to Riot.

I don't know how you get that... a simple reading of their report says very plainly his account was banned for life, and all future accounts are banned. i.e., if any account is found to be associated with said player, it will be banned.

2013 - DDoS attacks, 2014 - Account Sharing...  two of the most egregious of offenses according to the ToS, but he played on a Smurf... so it's fine now, he can play again?  More and more it sounds like Riot's out to try and make it look like people are permanently removed from the game, but when customers want to come back, they won't stop them.
I'm pretty sure smurfing was against ToS at the time, as well.

Smurfing has never been against ToS.  I can think of no reason why it should be. Queue times are annoying. Create a new account, level it up and play. When you reach the insane queue times again. Rinse and repeat.

You should probably tell Riot support that, since they don't know their own ToS, then.

From Nov, 2014:

"The creation of self-made "smurf" accounts, deceptively posting referral links, and using bots or scripts are in violation of the League of Legends Terms of Use"

[Terms of Use](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse)

[Summoner's Code](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/)

Please tell me where you are finding this, because there is no record on Smurfing I can find. Also, that Quote applies to 3 different issues. Smurfing, Botting, and RAF cheating.

>@Riot - unbanning a pro cheater Nicolaj “Incarnation” Jensen
>So, just to be clear here, you threw out a lifetime ban to this player. A LIFETIME BAN

lifetime ended

I want my all my ribbons back then. Immediately. Otherwise fuck you Riot. Oh it doesn't work that way? Hypocrite much? Eat a dick Riot, keep alienating your playerbase. Might as well ban me from the forum. Then let me keep posting on it, because fuck the rules, right? Oh wait. They still apply to me because I'm not a pro, right? Exactly.

This dude fucking DDOS'd people out of pure spite. I called someone a moron. Review my shit immediately.

Riot is bullshit.

Now we get to the cause of your rage, which may be why your Ribbons (who cares) were taken away. You were punished for behavioral issues, and seeing someone else reform and get rewarded for it makes you butt hurt.

You have just lost all validity to any argument you have on Incarnati0n or any other player that gets unbanned/rewarded for a change from Toxic Behavior to a decent (keep that shit to yourself) player.

Riot's punishments and enforcement has never had any consistency. In most cases its only about the PR it generates. Even all their fail punishment systems for us regular folks are even held up by Riot as some Mega success story as far as their PR goes. I mean they claim that only 2% of all games have any negativity due to their wonderful systems (even when one of the systems they hyped, the tribunal, has been down for a year).

Let that sink in. Riot claims only 2% of games have any negativity. Why expect any sort of honest accounting from Riot? The only thing they have been consistent about is their willingness to lie when it suites their PR interests.

Their annual "We care about stopping elo boosting" pretend BS is another example. Every year they crackdown so hard on elo boosting that there is every more of it the next year lol.

Just like the 27 million players they claim to have every day... meanwhile, go into any ARAM, 3v3, or dominion game and watch all the bots. Smurfs everywhere...

It wouldn't surprise me if the actual number of players was really less than WOW.
Yeah they got a great explanation, you would have gotten it if you had finished the news article you linked.

Really? So answer the question then. 

How does someone magically become reformed by ignoring the punishment that was handed down on them?

I'll tell you how: THEY DON'T.

If you're too stupid to see that, and you think Riot is justified in slapping the face of everyone player who follows the rules, isn't toxic, doesn't DDOS people, simply out of spite, then I'd rather you just leave this thread.
still not read the text you are complaining about...
just found out about this through T1s vlog... gross gore twitch banned  t1 league banned... yet this dude gets to walk free... yet another reason why i stopped supporting riot as a company...
You know Yesterday was April first right? -_-
Will my Diamond friend also get a mid season review for his chat ban? Just curious...

I assume they are just using this platform (with Incarnation) to test this new line of reform with Toxic players. (It also mentions something in the Article about that)

If it works out and Riot further follow this course than many more players may be "given a shot".

Bullshit. This is a simple case of Riot only caring about esports and their pro player base. They could care less about his Diamond friend. His diamond friend doesn't make them money and bring them new players from twitch streaming.

Meanwhile, normal players get banned every day from bullshit reports.. It's a fucking joke and every player of this game should be pissed off.

This is just like a couple seasons ago when they were battiling toxicity while the pro streamers were being toxic as hell on their streams. What did Riot do? They awarded them all fresh level 30 accounts, with all champs unlocked, then denied it, even though multiple pros confirmed it on their streams.
I think this will be longest bumped thread.
